intro: Holcosorus setaceus, commonly known as the hairy shield fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant has finely divided, hair-like structures on its fronds, giving it a delicate and intricate appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocks or tree trunks. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is a subject of interest in both botanical research and horticulture.
